title: Why comparing Wilt to Giannis is actually fair now

hook.text:
"You can't compare players from different eras!" 

[On-screen: "YES YOU CAN 🔥"]

Wrong. TUSG% makes it possible. Here's how...

explanation.text:
1962: Teams averaged 126 possessions per game (Wilt's era)
2020: Teams averaged 99.5 possessions per game (Giannis' era)

[Show pace comparison chart]

TUSG% adjusts for this. It asks: 'If both played at the SAME pace, who dominated more?'

Wilt 1962: 44.73 TUSG% (50 PPG adjusted for pace)
Giannis 2020: 43.51 TUSG% (29.5 PPG adjusted for pace)

Now it's fair. Same math, different eras.

example.text:
The result? Wilt edges Giannis in usage, but it's CLOSE.

[Show: #3 Wilt vs #4 Giannis all-time]

Without pace adjustment? Not even comparable. With TUSG%? Legitimate debate.
